me.pagekite.glen3b.library.bukkit.command

Class BaseCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.pagekite.glen3b.library.bukkit.command.BaseCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PreprocessedCommandHandler, org.bukkit.command.CommandExecutor, org.bukkit.command.TabCompleter, org.bukkit.command.TabExecutor

    public final class BaseCommand
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.bukkit.command.TabExecutor, PreprocessedCommandHandler
    Represents a base command that can execute subcommands.
    Author:
    Glen Husman

    • Constructor Detail

      • BaseCommand

        public BaseCommand(java.lang.String helpHeader,
           SubCommand... commands)
        Create a base command. For this class to execute a command, register(getCommand("commandNameInPluginYaml")) must be called.
        Parameters:
        helpHeader - The header to display on help pages, where %d is substituted with the page number. If used, color codes must be translated by the caller.
        commands - The array of commands which are executed via this base command.

    • Method Detail

      • getSubCommands

        public java.util.List<SubCommand> getSubCommands()
        Get a list of subcommands executed by this BaseCommand instance.
        Returns:
        A read only Collection<SubCommand> instance that can not be manipulated via reference to change the subcommands executed by this base command.

      • onCommand

        public boolean onCommand(org.bukkit.entity.Player sender,
                PreprocessableCommand command,
                java.lang.String label,
                java.lang.String[] args)
        Description copied from interface: PreprocessedCommandHandler
        Handles a command that was executed.
        Specified by:
        onCommand in interface PreprocessedCommandHandler
        Parameters:
        sender - The executor of the command.
        command - The command being executed.
        label - The alias used to execute the command.
        args - The arguments passed to the command, not counting the command itself.
        Returns:
        Whether to cancel the preprocessor event. This value should generally be true.
